instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
[B]Board history:[/B]

Customer bought this from eBay, it has been liquid damaged and ultrasonic cleaned already by whoever sold it.
There was no green light so replaced <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE_BILAT</SIGNAL> and over voltage protection now got green light.

[B]Power rails:[/B]

3V42 = 3V42
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3V3
Where is <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>? Can't find it on power rails page.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: EDIT: I don't think I'm going to waste my time on this board any longer. Parts missing all over it.
